lg.l: from My Much Hond 08. Friend at Helvedille.
Hail to the Sage Who from his Native Store
Produc'd a Science Never known before
Science of Words Once Jargon of the Schools
The Plague of Wise Men, & the boast of Fools
Made easy Now, & Useful, in Your Rules.
Where Wit and humour Equally Combine
Our Mirth at Once to raise and to refine
Till Now Not half the worth of Sounds We knew
Their Virtual Value Was Reserv'd for 1Dean Swift You;
To Trace their Various Mazes & Set forth
Their hidden force and Multiply their Worth:
For if to Express One's Sense, Our Words We Chuse
A Double Meaning. is of Double Use.Hail Sacred Art! by What Misterious Name
Shall I adore thee Various, and the Same?
The Muses Proteus, Skill'd with Grateful Change
Through all the pleasing forms of Wit to Range;
In Quick Succession Yet retain thrô all
Some faint Resemblance of the Original.Hail Fairest Offspring of prodigious birth
At Once the Parent & the Child of Mirth!
With Chloes Charms thy Airy form can Vie,
And with thy Smiles, as Many Thousands dye:
The pleasing pain thrô all their Vitals thrills,
With Subtle force, and 2an Extreme proper Epithet. tickles as it Kills;
Thee too like her the dying Swains persue
As Gay. as Careless. as Inconstant too,
To Raise Yet More thy Merit & thy fame
The Cyprian Goddess Glories in thy Name
Pleas'd to be thought the laughter loving Dame.Nor less thy Praise, Nor less thy Power to WoundThou lovely fleeting Image of a Sound.Y01A389O
